Alzheimerâs is tough. And while there is no cure, getting help should be 100x easier than it is today. Weâve raised over $6 million to solve that problem. 

When someone is going through the disease, there are many different things they need help with (i.e. memory issues, depression, fall risk, safety in the home, etc). The primary person responsible for that care is one of the patientâs loved ones â usually a child or a spouse.

Thatâs a really difficult thing for the loved one to do. Itâs stressful, time consuming, and difficult. If we can make their lives easier, we can not only improve their experience but also create better patient outcomes.

Weâre building the worldâs first one-stop-shop, d2c care platform for Alzheimerâs, starting by optimizing the care monitoring, management, and intervention processes.

founders.name: Nikhil Patel, Founder
founders.description: CEO of Craniometrix. Nikhil is a published author on digital diagnostics for Alzheimer's disease.

generated_description:
**Craniometrix: Revolutionizing Alzheimer’s Care**

Founded in 2021 and based in New York, Craniometrix is a forward-thinking health-tech company on a mission to simplify and improve care for Alzheimer’s patients and their families. The company emerged from the sobering reality that while Alzheimer’s is a challenging and incurable disease, accessing support shouldn’t be a Herculean task. With over $6 million in funding under its belt, Craniometrix is committed to creating a one-stop-shop care platform tailored for this need.

At the heart of Craniometrix's platform is the recognition that caregivers—often spouses or children—carry the weight of providing care. This role can lead to significant stress and time demands. By optimizing the monitoring, management, and intervention processes, Craniometrix aims to alleviate the burden on caregivers and enhance outcomes for patients.

### The Platform

Craniometrix is leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to build a direct-to-consumer (D2C) care platform that streamlines every aspect of dementia care. Central to their offering is the *CareCentral* application; it serves as a collaborative hub for healthcare providers and care navigators to ensure compliance with the Medicare GUIDE model while delivering top-notch support.

In addition, Craniometrix has teamed up with the esteemed MIND at Home program developed at Johns Hopkins. Their integrated approach ensures that healthcare professionals can maintain a continuous line of communication, ultimately driving better patient outcomes. Best of all, the services are offered at no cost to patients, thanks to reimbursements made through Medicare's new initiatives.

### The Team

With a compact team of five, Craniometrix is part of the Y Combinator Batch W22, a prestigious accelerator known for nurturing some of the most innovative startups. Their group partner is "nan," reflecting a robust backing that allows them to push boundaries within the neurotechnology and health-tech sectors.

### Why Craniometrix?

1. **Innovation-Driven:** The use of AI and advanced tech forms the backbone of their platform, enabling personalized care solutions.
  
2. **Patient-Centered Approach:** Every feature is crafted with the dignity and wellbeing of patients as the priority.

3. **Collaborative Care:** It enhances communication amongst healthcare professionals, coordinating efforts to improve patient support.

### Looking Ahead

As Craniometrix makes strides towards unlocking unprecedented revenue opportunities for healthcare providers while maintaining high-quality care for dementia patients, the company also sets a standard within the neurotechnology field. Their commitment to compassionate, tech-driven solutions is not just revolutionary; it’s essential.

If you’re interested in exploring their platform, check out their website at [Craniometrix](https://craniometrix.com).

**In a world where Alzheimer’s is a harrowing reality, Craniometrix is championing change, proving that with the right tools and compassion, better care is not just possible—it’s here.**
